metadata.Title: CVE-2023-28370 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Open redirect vulnerability in Tornado versions 6.3.1 and earlier allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to redirect a user to an arbitrary web site and conduct a phishing attack by having user access a specially crafted URL.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28370` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-tornado - 4.2.1-1ubuntu3.1+esm1
python3-tornado - 4.2.1-1ubuntu3.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> until salt version v3006.1, tornado source was included as vendored code.

criterions.comment: python-tornado package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.2.1-1ubuntu3.1+esm1').
salt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
